intro: Phylica pulchella, commonly known as the silver leaf phylica, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Phylica pulchella is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
